main event: Two separate sightings in Corpus Christi, Texas, involving unidentified flying objects perceived as potential meteors.
interesting points: The first sighting involved a solid cylinder surrounded by a glowing yellow light that appeared to explode,The object was at approximately 50,000 ft, emitting sparks resembling a firecracker,The observer was at a drive-in theater with visibility up to 10 miles,The second sighting featured a bright white flash with a duration of half a second and a short smoke trail,The same location witnessed two reports of unidentified objects on consecutive dates in September 1967.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects possibly resembling meteors
witness description: an 8-year-old boy and a 50-year-old watch commander experienced in aerial visual observation
